intro: Goodyera augustini, commonly known as the velvet tongs orchid, is a terrestrial orchid belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves that are often covered in a dense, hairy layer. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in a spike, which are typically borne on a short, erect stem. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Goodyera augustini is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including the Philippines and Indonesia.
